p: Finally, nucleic acid-based vaccines against CHIKV are under development. These vaccines have clear advantages, from ease of production, to safety, to the ability to induce both humoral and cell-mediated immunity; however many have shown a relatively low immunogenicity, requiring large doses, repeated boosters, and the use of adjuvants [ 12]. One RNA-based vaccine, VAL-181388, is recruiting for a Phase 1 clinical trial ( Table 1).
